creator: mangst@inventec.ch
text:
If you cut and paste a subtree, the order of its children changes. Steps to
reproduce:
- build clean / build
- import example content
- go to site tab
- note the order of the children of subtree "Resource type examples": X/L/O/C
- cut subtree "Resource type examples"
- select subtree "Tutorials"
- paste subtree "Resource type examples"
- note the order of the children of subtree "Resource type examples" has changed
to: C/O/X/L (or whatever; i feel like getting a different order every time)

creator: andreas@apache.org
text:
The problem is that DocumentManagerImpl.copyAll() uses a NodeSet instead of a
preorder traversing.

> Fixed in revision 595371.

Thanks, Andreas!

Probably nitpicking, but:

- SiteUtil.getSubSite() has a JavaDoc comment that says "...all nodes which
require this node, in preorder". I guess this is wrong since getSubSite()
returns a NodeSet?
creator: mangst@inventec.ch

text:
(In reply to comment #3)
> - SiteUtil.getSubSite() has a JavaDoc comment that says "...all nodes which
> require this node, in preorder". I guess this is wrong since getSubSite()
> returns a NodeSet?

Good point, there is no explicit order in a node set. Maybe the javadoc comment
is from an older version with a different return type.

Apart from that, maybe we could get rid of the subsite stuff since
SiteNode.getChildren() was introduced.
creator: andreas@apache.org
